intro: Euploca heterantha, commonly known as the variable euploca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Euploca heterantha is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
